Articles.Content:
Don't press. What's the point of infinite KSP with no way to play it?!

Press for the ability to change Earth gravity to Lunar gravity as often as you'd like and for as long as you want each time. However, every second you spend in Lunar Gravity is one you must spend under Jupiter-strength gravity.

don't press because i would prefer not to collapse under my own weight even though i am only 120 lbs in Earth gravity

press to gain the power of telepathy but you will forced to have to hear the unnecessary thoughts of stupid people that surround you

I would not, I mean, that's what the internet's for!

Press the button and be able to time travel, but every time you travel, there's a 10% chance you will create a rip in space and time that will destroy the universe...

press it, screw it I know a doctor

press to live on mars alone (for the first few years) in a self sustaining base but you may never return to Earth...

screw it yes

press to earn a free computer it is run by glados and it is 10 years old

Yes...

I mean, there are no upsides to this, but I will sure be GLaD to have some (robotic) company.

PRESS IT! screw it, i have been thinking with portals since the first game

press to get a computer run by Hal

I would because if I can befriend Hal then him and I would be unstoppable.

If you press the button, you will be teleported to the Apollo 11 Mission, leaving room in the lander for one other man. Will you choose Neil or Buzz to die?

We find a way to cram us in. I'm not that big.

If you press the button, you get a million dollars, but Justin bieber dies. Will you do it?(tip, this is actually from their website)

Where is the downside?

If you press the button, you become an astronaut. But Squad is shut down overnight. How generous do you feel?

No chance. Haven't you seen Gravity?

If you press the button, aliens take you away to live a life of wonder in a massive galactic federation, but your mother-in-law comes with you. If you do not have a mother-in-law, one will be assigned to you.

I press it, since by definition to have a mother-in-law, you must also have a wife.

If you press the button, there is a 50% chance that all war will end. The other 50%? The Earth explodes instantly. Do you confirm?
*Presses It*
ummmmmmmmm... you need to give me a button...
Mmkay, if you press the button someone will donate 1 billion dollars to squad. But someone you know will come down with Parkinson's. Do you press it?

no i am not that type of person

press the button to be the first to pilot SpaceX's new V2 Dragon to ISS but there is a 60% chance of it exploding upon dock with the station

Do eet!

Press the button, and you're a kerbal, in the KSP universe. But you're also their first to go to test pilot.

No. What, you think I'm stupid?

Press the button, and you will get a copy of either of these games for free: XCOM: Enemy Within or Big Rigs: Over The Road Racing. Odds in favor of the latter. Do you confirm?

Hell no.

Press the button and make Earth implode.

Nope.

Press the button and you will get the most beastly computer existing with the current technology, and all future upgrades will be free, but you will never be able to meet living things again.

Ha easy. Il press it. I don't meet anyone anyway..... I need some friends

Press it, and you will become a KSP master. However, you wont be able to crash ships, kill kerbals or build silly and stupid crafts.

Hellz no.

Pressing this button will have a 70% percent chance of giving you free copies of any game you want forever, or a 30% percent chance of all bad things that could happen happening everywhere.

Press and hope for the best.

Pressing this button will give you 55% unlimited MLG prowess, or a 45% chance of endless screamers until death.

No. I don't even know what MLG prowess is.

Pressing this button will move you into your favourite game universe.

You can't choose which character you become.

Hmm... *gets put in Elder Scrolls, becomes the Fan*

No.

Press this button and either Cosmos will be renewed for a second season or the only thing on TV for the rest of time is Jack Van Impe. The odds are in favor of Cosmos, but...
